title: Python Meetup March: Rustacean Python Skills 🐍 🦀
description:
For the month of march, we have a double session about **Rust** 🦀 !:
\-\-\-\-

* ➡️ **What: Python and Rust**
* 📢 **Who**: Dirk Lüdtke
* ⏱ **Duration**: 30 minutes
* 👅 **Language**: English
* 🧐 **Abstract**: As a passionate Python developer who has recently started to learn Rust, I would like to share my experiences how these two programming languages complement each other and how one can use both of them to optimize the own projects.

\-\-\-

* ➡️ **What: Hands on Polars 🐻‍❄️, an alternative to data frames leveraging in Rust**
* 📢 **Who**: Javier Martínez
* ⏱ **Duration**: 30 minutes
* 👅 **Language**: English
* 🧐 **Abstract**: Data frames are daily bread and butter in data science. Most of us use Pandas 🐼 data frames as the main tool when performing our analysis.

In this session we are going to introduce Polars a relatively new library written in Rust that could be handy in our toolbox. We will compare its performance, put our hands on it and try to find which is the best way to replace analysis done with Pandas with Polars. All of it with a pinch of Rust.

\-\-\-\-
➡️ Location
Codurance:
[Carrer de Pallars 99, 4th floor, room 41, Barcelona, 08018](https://maps.app.goo.gl/Z7eb1XyPJZYfLM3h8)

➡️ Access Control

* 🛂 The security access control requires an **attendee list** (full name) and a **means of identification** (DNI, NIE, passport)

* 🪪 You’ll be asked to provide that ID to access the building.
* 🚸 People under 18 years old shall be accompanied by a legal guardian

\-\-\-\-
➡️ Only register if you can attend!

* 🪑 There are limited seats, so please be responsible when signing up
* 🚷 If you can't make it, please free up your seat, so someone else can attend. We keep a list with repeated offenders!
